archetype_name: Family Low-Carb Weeknight Bowls & Wraps (15–30, Mild)
name: Mild Pork Fajita Cauliflower Rice Bowls
description: Quick, low-carb fajita-style pork and peppers served over cauliflower rice with lime, avocado, and salsa. Family-friendly seasoning and ready in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Trim and thinly slice pork chops into bite-size strips.
Slice peppers into strips and slice onions thinly.
Halve the lime; cut one half into wedges and reserve.
Halve, pit, and slice the avocado.
cook_steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; add 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Add sliced onions and peppers with a pinch of salt; sauté 4–5 minutes until softened and lightly charred. Transfer to a bowl.
Return skillet to medium-high; add 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Add pork strips, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Cook 4–6 minutes, stirring, until just cooked through.
Return peppers and onions to the skillet; toss with pork. Squeeze half the lime over the mixture. Taste and adjust salt.
In a separate skillet over medium heat, warm cauliflower rice with 1 teaspoon olive oil and a pinch of salt for 3–4 minutes, stirring, until hot and tender-crisp.
Assemble bowls: divide cauliflower rice among 4 bowls. Top with pork-pepper mixture, avocado slices, and spoonfuls of salsa.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with lime wedges.
